Detailed Description

Helper Functions for the Configuration Framework.

OCTEON_CN68XX introduces a flexible hw interface configuration scheme. To cope with this change and the requirements of configurability for other system resources, e.g., IPD/PIP pknd and PKO ports and queues, a configuration framework for the SDK is designed. It has two goals: first to recognize and establish the default configuration and, second, to allow the user to define key parameters in a high-level language.

The helper functions query the QLM setup to help achieving the first goal.

The second goal is accomplished by generating cvmx_helper_cfg_init() from a high-level lanaguage.

Revision
0

#define cvmx_helper_cfg_assert ( cond   ) 
Value:
do {                                \
        if (!(cond))                        \
        {                               \
            cvmx_dprintf("cvmx_helper_cfg_assert (%s) at %s:%d\n",  \
            #cond, __FILE__, __LINE__);             \
        }                               \
    } while (0)
